intro: Lepidostemon williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' lepidostemon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lepidostemon williamsii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
